The letter is dated "Basel, den 15. Aug. 1923" (Basel, August 15, 1923). While I can see this is addressed to "An die Basler Rheinschiffahrts A.-G." (To the Basel Rhine Shipping Company) and contains a salutation "Sehr geehrte Herren," (Dear Sirs), the letter doesn't contain:
- A specific title
- The name of the individual sender (only shows "BASLER FERSCHENFAHRTSGESELLSCHAFT" as the organization letterhead)
- Specific named recipients (only the general address to the company)

There appears to be a signature at the bottom, but it's not clearly legible enough to determine the specific name of the sender.
